pic1_alt: A screenshot from HollywoodAgeGap.com/, plotting ages in years of the members of the primary love interest in each of six films. Male members of the couple are shown as blue squares, and female members as purple circles. The ages are plotted on a number line for each film, and the age is also shown as a large number. The age differences are depicted from highest (Harold and Maude, 1971, 52 years) to lowest out of these six films (Poison Ivy, 1992, 42 years).
pic2_alt: The movie poster for the 1971 film Harold and Maude, with the tagline 'His hangups are hilarious.' The poster shows a cartoon depiction of the younger member of the couple, Harold, holding his tie above his head as if hanging himself.
